text: Alma Cogan (19 May 1932 â€“ 26 October 1966) was an English singer of traditional pop in the 1950s and early 1960s. She was called "the girl with the giggle in her voice".Mark Simpson, Saint Morrissey: A Portrait of This Charming Man by an Alarming Fan (New York: Touchstone, 2003), p. 240 One of her hit songs was "Sugartime".Andrew Hickey, Preservation: The Kinks' Music 1964-1974 (Andrew Hickey, 2012), p. 166 It was released in 1958 alongside The McGuire Sisters' version. == Personal life == Cogan was born in the East End of London, England. She died after ovarian cancer at age thirty-four. == References == == Other websites == * Alma Cogan, Sugartime, YouTube Category:English pop musicians Category:People from London Category:1932 births Category:1966 deaths
title: Alma Cogan
